Shri Dharmasthala Manjunatheshwara Institute of Technology is the Abreivation

SDM Institute of Technology is an ambition driven technological institution situated in Ujire within the homely ambiance of SDM Institutions and the serenity of the Western Ghats. Managed by SDM Educational Society Ujire under the impeccable leadership of Sri. D. Veerendra Heggade.

patterns: Where is computer science science HOD
responses: Dr. Thyagaraju G S is the current HoD of Computer Science Department.He has completed his M.Tech. in the year 2001 from University of Mysore and Ph.D. in the year 2014 from VTU Belagavi. His areas of interest are Contextual Artificial Intelligence and Theory of Mind. He has published 3 books and 52 national and international research papers. He is the life member of IETE.

patterns: how far is hostel from college
responses: The hostel environment at SDMIT nurtures the idea of 'A home away from home'.There are separate hostel blocks for boys and girls aimed at providing a homely, conducive and progressive environment. This is achieved by facilitating students in their studies, co-curricular and extra-curricular activities in a healthy and caring atmosphere. Herein at SDMIT, 70% of our students stay at Hostels, in part due to the excellent infrastructure and environment provided by the college.It is located within sdmit campus.For more details visit here

patterns: list of events organised in college
list of events conducted in college
What events are conducted in college
Are there any event held at college
responses: Events are always the most awaited moments for all budding artists. The college provides ample opportunities for the students to compete in a diverse range of competitions in and out of the college. There are over 40 inter-class competitions conducted by the college every year on account of the college day covering both literary and fine arts; and there are many inter-collegiate competitions open for the students to exhibit their talent. Food, accommodation and transport facilities are taken care of by the management when students represent the institution in inter-collegiate competitions.The college conducts a 2-day State Level Science Fair EXPERIA for the PU students and Apart from the above hobby clubs, the technical clubs and associations are active at department levels. To name some, IOT club, Web development club, Energy club, Eagers association, Techtronics, Coding club, etc.

patterns: eligibility criteria to get into this college
responses: Candidate should have passed 10+2 or equivalent course in English as one of the languages of study with a minimum of 45% and above (40% in case of SC/ST, Category I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B) aggregate marks in Physics, Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Biology/ Biotechnology/ Computer/ Electronics(anyone)as an optional subject from a recognized board.

patterns: What are the Requirements for karnataka candidates
responses: May opt for admission through K-CET or COMEDK quota. Selection under K-CET quota seats is based on the ranking scored in K- CET; admission under COMEDK quota is based on the ranking obtained in the COMEDK Entrance Test followed by counseling. For detailed eligibility conditions/ clause, please visit KEA website: https://cetonline.karnataka.gov.in/kea/

patterns: What are needed for non karnataka candidates
non karnataka candidates needs for college
responses: Candidates outside Karnataka need to obtain COMEDK score and apply for admission through COMEDK counseling procedure.

patterns: What are the documents Required for NRI and Foreign candidates
documents Required for NRI and Foreign candidates
NRI and Foreign candidates documents Required for college
responses: Admission is open to NRI / Foreign candidates who have passed 12th standard or equivalent examination recognized by AIU (Association of Indian Universities). The eligibility criterion is as mentioned above.

patterns: How management quota admission process works
Tell me about management admission process
responses: Admission to the management quota seats is open to Karnataka, non-Karnataka, and NRI students. However, the candidate should have appeared and obtained a valid K-CET/ COMEDK/JEE / AIEEE ranking score. Eligible students (those who meet qualifying requirements as per the eligibility criteria) may contact the SDMIT admissions section in order to obtain the application form. Candidates will be selected based on their academic merit and ranking.

patterns: lateral entry process for diploma students
what is lateral entry admission process
responses: Diploma Holders in engineering with an aggregate minimum of 45% marks and above (40% in case of SC/ ST and Backward Classes of Karnataka) taken together in all the subjects of the final year (V and VI sem) conducted by the Board of Technical Examination, Government of Karnataka or its equivalent, are eligible for admission to the corresponding branch of II year engineering. Candidates must have taken the Common Entrance Test (DCET) conducted by the K-CET Cell for diploma students. Seats will be allotted by K-CET Cell through a centralized counseling process.

patterns: documents needed at the time of admission
documents required at the time of admission
What document are required for admission
Which document to bring for admission
what documents do I need for admission
responses:
1.Rank Card of the entrance exam taken/ Admit Card (K-CET/ COMEDK as applicable)
2.SSLC/ 10th Marks Card
3.PUC/ 12th Marks Card or equivalent
4.Transfer Certificate
5.Conduct Certificate from the Principal of the institution last studied
6.Photographs: 4 Passport size, 4 Stamp size
7.Migration Certificate (for non-Karnataka Boards-ICSE, CBSE etc.)
8.Caste / Caste Income Certificate issued by Concerned Tahsildar for SC / ST in Form-D, Category-I in form E and 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B in Form F (If claiming reservation benefits)
9.Rural Study Certificate from 1st to 10th std for 10 complete years (If claiming Rural quota)
10.Kannada Medium Study Certificate from 1st to 10th std for 10 complete years (If claiming Kannada Medium quota)
11.Candidate's Study certificate
12.Attested copies of Address proof (AadhaarCard/Voter ID)
13.One self-addressed envelope with Rs.5 stamp.

patterns: does the college have library facility
responses: The academic library is the real powerhouse of any educational institution and conveys its integral role in supporting the core mission of higher education. SDMIT library is housed in a separate 2-storied building with an area of 1,300 sq.m with modern amenities and facilities. The infrastructure has a centralized facility with a seating capacity of 300 and an open access system for users. It has 35,000 printed resources of books in 6,651 titles, journals, bound volumes and student project reports. Routine activities like data entry, information storage, OPAC search, retrieval, circulation, bar-coding of books, usage index, etc. are carried out using an EERPMS software developed in-house. and for more visit here

Our University has Excellent Infrastructure. Campus is clean. The infrastructure is good, we have all the necessary facilities. We have labs, an auditorium, a sports ground, and a place for cultural events. Many numbers of books and computers are present in our college. The classroom is equipped with projectors and smartboards.

Campus life at SDMIT is confidently amongst the best atmospheres an institution can manage to provide for the holistic growth of young minds. The academic growth is firmly rooted in religious, disciplinary, social and progressive values, as validated by every student who has experienced campus life here. Not only does the campus provide all the facilities required for a student to thrive on intellectual and personal levels, it also ensures that the students are pushed beyond their boundaries to implement their learning and produce noteworthy outcomes. Majority of the students and staff carry out large number of social benefit activities like blood donation camps, mentoring and motivating primary and high school students, involving/conducting Swachhata Abhiyaan, providing awareness among the public about road safety, etc.

patterns: How many teaching staff are there
responses: There are 50+ teaching staff are there in various branches.

patterns: How many cse faculty are there
responses: There are 10+ teaching staff are there in cse branch.

ORATOR CLUB:SDMIT, Orators Club have been started with the aim to make students fluent speakers of English, to motivate, guide & prepare students for real public speaking. The Orators Club provides the perfect platform for students to give voice to their deepest thoughts with a perfect blend of confidence, vocabulary and expression. This Club shapes the oration skills of a student by not just encouraging him to speak but also making him a good listener. Doing away with stage fear and breaking the shyness, young blooming students transformed into confident orators. YOUTH RED CROSS :Youth Red Cross is a voluntary organization functioning at SDMIT since 2011. This unit functions with social responsibility, intending to create better living conditions for the deserving in the society through student volunteers. This ensures creation of a student society that is responsible and oriented in social welfare. Students of SDMIT volunteer to be a part of Youth Red Cross activities that are conducted through out the year. Youth Red Cross organizes activities like blood donation camps, free health checkup camps and health awareness programs that are completely managed by students under the leadership of concerned faculty.
CET code : E152
